Comment: I didn't find his class challenging at all.  He teaches more at a masters level than at a doctoral level.  He is condescending at times.
No Comments

Anna's class was great. She left the floor open for discussion and encouraged students to share their ideas with the rest of the class. You aren't graded on very much, but I thought that was good because it gave me time to perfect everything that she did have us do.

Dr. Stetsenko practices what she preaches - her classes are open fora for students to explore the subject matter and readings from their own positions, and to learn in their own pace. The level is high and the texts demanding, but Dr. Stetsenko efforts to challenge and support students to think, learn, and develop their scholarship are laudable.

Until today it remains the most important course of my academic career. I wish I would have "rated" it sooner but now that I am myself an instructor I truly understand the value in this kind of feedback. The readings were challenging but Anna never underestimated our capacity to continuously develop. How we understand human development matters!

Stetsenko's class changed my life. The material she provided was thoughtful, very challenging and worth the arduous classwork. I am very grateful for a professor like Dr. Stetsenko because she is there to help her students edify their work, not hers (which she is also very passionate about).She believes in her students infinite potential & beyond!

She is an amazing professor. Her passion is evident in the classroom and she genuinely wants students to learn. She presents arguments from multiple sides and lets you decide for yourself. Breaks down theoretical concepts and makes them easy to understand.  I've taken multiple classes with her. She will change your life and how you view the world!

She's a difficult teacher to have if she doesn't like you to begin with! She can play favorites with her students and sometimes really chews some of them out. Still, she's obviously smart and you will learn a LOT about her favored theories and Vygotsky from her. It's too bad she doesn't balance it out more, however.

The woman is obsessed with one thing and one thing only -- Vygotsky and activity theory.   Most of the time she makes no sense; students just speak to fill up the class time.  At the doctoral level she should teach students things that will be useful for teaching undergraduates or the types of research skills necessary for finding a job after gradu

He's a very nice guy and obviously very smart but his class was very boring and his readings were a complete and utter snooze. He always gives a final term paper and sometimes a midterm and gives helpful feedback on that. It's just that I feel like I learned nothing from his class afterward! Nice guy but I wouldn't take a class with him again.
a good teacher
great in many ways
not sure

Gary is the best stats professor I've ever had.  He brings such clarity to complex analyses.  He is so dedicated to teaching and has the patience of a Saint with his students.  He has helped me reclaim my love of math and applied statistics.  He grounds research techniques so you can understand them and how they work in real life.  Simply the best!

Michelle Fine is awesome! Every class she would bring snacks for us. She encourages students to reflect on their own journeys and look to the future: where they want to be and how they want to change the discipline for the better. I found all the assignments somewhat tough but very helpful.
Dr. Fine is a gem, a teacher who takes seriously the consequences of believing learning is about whole persons working together to understand themselves and their relationships to their worlds

Her methodologies were a little skewed. They might work in one section of the world but they might not work somewhere else. Had the sense that she's been published so many times that she knew everything and there wasn't room for an intellectual debate.
The best teacher I've ever had. Unfortunately, I had to wait until graduate school to find the great teacher that everyone talks about as having changed their lives.
One of the Best Teachers I have ever had.
Very helpful and educational too much reading though
Brilliant. Like a roller coaster ride. Wonderful.
Brilliant
Lombardi is a prince. I love this guy.
Fun, personable, and knows his material.  Totally enjoyed taking his class and will take any class with him again!

Be prepare to WORK and READ. This is one of the classes I have had to work the most. Every week there's a DB post and 2 replies due, based on the week's readings, which can be a lot to read. There's 5 1hr-quizzes, and 6 blog post. There's one fieldwork. Overall, she does her job as a professor, and inspired me to continue learning about Africa.
Very good professor, actively involved.  Grades fairly.  Glad I took her class.

ONLINE -- Fantastic professor!  She can be tough so make sure you take the class seriously & use the discussion board.  Lots of reading but the books are intersting.  It's online but she's always very present and interested in her students.  She will give you a chance to pass the class!  She is wonderful!

Sociology of Gender: If you've never thought about gender in a semi-critical manner, go ahead and take this course.  You'll get a decent introduction but don't expect to walk away knowing the latest debates in this field.  Hester is very approachable but her perspective is limited.  Also, it took 2 years and much nagging to get feedback on my paper
should just publish
Will take some getting used to for some students.
i did not enjoy her teaching style, and got very little from the class.
No Comments

I'll agree with the previous rater, she was extremely clear about content and expectations. She requires students to present one weeks reading after which she leads discussions aroung the book. She also asks that you write four brief response papers, which help to keep you honest and on task with the reading. Overall a great experience.
Interesting lectures and discussion.  She is crystal clear both with regards to the material she presents and her expectations of you.
Professor Dauben, not only is he knowledgeable and helpful, he is really nice.  He definitely is a top notch professor.

Dauben is not an easy professor, but he will push you to a level that you will be proud of.  He is extremely detailed in his critiques and very helpful.  I took his class online and could clearly sense his kindness.  He is also clearly very intelligent and knowledgeable.  A great instructor that I recommend to those who want to learn & work hard!
A great professor - very knowledgeable, helpful and patient. We need more like him.
Great guy. Very smart.Open for discussion.by the way his name is Edelstein
useless teacher. useless person never there for the students. in her cleass you are on your own. be careful what you say to her because it goes far.

interesting readings and lecture/discussions. Integrates own published work and a great overview of developmental politics. lets the men dominate the discussion a bit but that's the way most classes are.

interesting readings and lecture/discussions. Integrates own published work and a great overview of developmental politics. lets the men dominate the discussion a bit but that's the way most classes are. helpful with your work when needed.
blah blah
On of the best professor for microeconomic. We could learn a lot during a short amount of time. She was very communicative, knowledgeable, explain the topics in easy way. I highly recommend her.
Not attentive, stubborn, do not take her .

Awful! She reads back everything from the slides and then gets mad at you when you dont attend her lectures. She does not explain the material well. Speaking English does not flow fluently for her. Lectures are very boring. I had to file a complaint for her after she was messing with my grades, in the end i got the grades that i earned. Avoid!
She only take class by her power point slide, you don't need to be on the class to see the slide. You can read it any time from blackboard.

Prof. Uctum teaches the class by reading her notes from the screen.  This makes the class unbelievably boring and difficult to follow because all you want to do after a few minutes is sleep. The notes she provides are not well organized. The content of the course is interesting and challenging, however, the instruction calls for some improvement.

The most subjective grader I have ever encountered.  Easily frustrated; unclear expectations on graded work.  I was warned about him and took his class anyway.  Terrible mistake on my part.  Avoid if at all possible.

This guy has absolutely no idea how to teach.  He expects all students, even those with no prior knowledge of the language, to pick up several new tenses per week of the summer.  And then, if you struggle, he berates you in class.  Worst teacher ever.
ATTENDANCE / EXAM GRADES. V.A.L.I.D

Jill is the best teacher EVER. Take her class, you will learn loads. She is very helpful and attentive to the needs of her students. Very fun and adventurous, she inspires good work. She does really cool research in Belize, ask her about it if you get the chance. Go take Ethnobotany with her at ITEC in Panama!
Best professor ever. Blew my mind. Hot hot hot!!!

This was an awesome class! Prof. Petraeus is an excellent teacher who brought vast experience and insight into the classroom. We covered a broad range of issues, and he emphasized writing and presentation skills. I highly recommend this course, but you'll have to work hard to ensure you are prepared for class. A lot of reading is required.
really one of the most knowledgable people I've ever had the pleasure of being taught by. fantastic lecturer on really interesting and relevant subject matter.

Professor Petraeus is a great teacher, easily one of the best I've ever had. The skills i honed in his class have made me a better writer and a more confident presenter. The in-class discussion were always fascinating. I honestly wish I could take this class again!

Study the developments revolutionizing our world, practice giving rapid-fire briefings, prepare congressional testimony and policy papers. Throughout Dr. Petraeus provides plenty of feedback. He is also a willing resource to hard-working students outside of class. Finally, he takes his teaching seriously, and his work ethic is truly inspirational.

He is the greatest professor I've ever had in my college career, and one of the most brilliant people I've come across. Professor Petraeus' class is very engaging, challenging, and exciting. He really helps you along the way to break out of your comfort zone and push new boundaries; you'll grow as a speaker and writer. Highly recommend taking him!

Taking a class with General Petraeus was one of the highlights of my undergraduate career. His class pushed me outside of my academic comfort zone, and I'm better off for it. I cannot recommend his class highly enough.

Prof. Petraeus was an excellent teacher, as interested in teaching public speaking and clear writing as he is in the actual content of the course. He provides clear and detailed feedback on all assignments, is phenomenally well-informed, and goes out of his way to help students he likes after the course is over.

Best class I've taken in my college career. Prof. Petraeus explained complex material in a manner that made it both easy and interesting to learn. He strengthened our understanding of various subjects and encouraged us to think beyond the reading. Overall, he fostered a comfortable, but yet challenging, environment that promoted true learning.

He's spectacular at teaching but I don't think we ever learned anything that was related precisely to the assignments. I'm actually still not sure what the class was really about. Also, he's pretty intense when it comes to knowing the material from the readings but if you get his questions right, he really lends you the applause.
Deeply knowledgeable and goes out of his way to help students
Great Guy

I joined after I was shocked by how negative his rating was.  Then  I understood.  Dr. Maher is a phenomenal professor - clear, well prepared, and engaging.  He works hard, and is an incredibly nice guy.  He is, however, hard.  I see this as a positive, which is why I have him 5 for easiness.

Prof. Zakeri is a force of nature. A phenomenon. His Analysis class is the best course I've ever taken, easily. His writing on the blackboard looks like LaTeX. His energy is unbelievable and I've never once seen him stumped, or caught off guard by a question.  I rated 5 for "easiness" because he is not easy, (though he does make it look easy).
He teaches anything but algorithms. I don't think he knows the material. He refuses any kind of help.  Things he teaches are not related to course content. Worst ever.
He's a nice person but his teaching style, exams, and grading are very difficult.
Avoid
Dreadful person. Stay away at all costs.

Not knowledgeable in the topic at a level appropriate for this level of study - seems very full of it! Completely oblivious to how awful she is, which makes her extremely difficult to communicate with - she is easily agitated and flustered and ends up behaving/speaking obnoxiously.

She didn't seem to have much experience on teaching. She seemed interested on the topics but her classes should have been much more structured and planned. Did not use book, which might have been a good idea.
Attend the class, take notes.  Don't be  late to class. Final was open book, and  he gave hints to what questions would appear in the exam. Heard he gives a C for just appearing in the exam..
As a foreign student, I have some difficulties in understanding his accent. But I will listen to my record after class. Latter, I realized that this class is excellent, cool as professor said.

I took the Demographic Methods course with Prof. Heiland. It was a lot of work & he is a thorough grader but I can easily say that I learned so much in this class. He is very knowledgeable about the subject and took the time to provide feedback on all the assignments and the final paper. If you work hard and want to learn dem methods take his class

Extremely important science! Complex concepts thus not easy to teach, but if you're lucky to find an excellent professor, you'll surely enjoy demography, and Prof. Heiland is one. Engaging and interested in students' learning, his HWs probably like nothing you've seen before but if you do all four, you'll know more about demography than you expect.

Dr. Heiland is amazing. Hands-down one of the best professors I have ever had. The class is tough because the material is challenging, but all assignments really reinforce your understanding of the material. He is incredibly helpful, he makes the material accessible and interesting, and I recommend this class to any student up for a challenge.
A great prof! Smart, knowledgable, approachable, so professional and dignified in the class. She can explain theoretical or practical stats in an easy to comprehend way.
ANTI-SEMETIC. I DID NOT FEEL SAFE IN CLASS !!!!!!!!

Ruth is brilliant in her field but the class professor in that she's scatterbrained and does not always finish her sentences.  I've taken two classes with her that are co-taught and the other professor helped keep the course on track.  Ruth is very supportive of students, however, and will funnel opportunities your way if she likes your work.

The class was very disorganized and hard to follow. Also, the requirements were not clear enough and then grading was tough, which from my perspective seemed completely unfair after a semester of unstructured discussions, not following through with readings, and lack of clarity on expectations.

Professor Halle's video lectures were very informative. In fact, I was able to do the weekly discussions with just the video lectures (in place of the readings). His quizzes are fair as well. You get to choose your own topic for the final paper---which is great, because who wants to write 6 pages on a snoozer?

I took law and literature. It was online and people did not talk much at first, but the material was different, she read two drafts of my paper and gave me comments and each time it got a lot better. It would have been nice to have more guidance on presentations, and I wish I had done office hours more in the beginning.She is a really caring prof.

Readings were great, some unexpected but still interesting. Literature is her thing, but 7000 was varied--theory, law, lit, sociology. Some class discussions were superfun, like this is what grad school should be! Shld have gone to more offhours, she helped my writing a LOT last semester-my papers this year are just better.
Throughout the whole 4 years of my university studies, this guy is the winner for being the worse. Terrible!
I'm learning so much- he's the best!
Take any other, I believe none can be worse.
This professor is like he fell firm the sky and forgot he was student also. He will laugh with you during lectures-but grade will make you cry. Worst !
Worst professor ever, avoid if possible.
I was 4.0 GPA, ruined it with this person. I wish I took seriously the bad reviews about him. I wish...

Before going to his class I read the comments on Prof. Gelmi and I had a very bad idea about him. They are not accurate. He is one of the best professors I have had. Very funny own its own way. Open minded and inspiring. Obviously because is a language course you are required to practice and do work but he is very clear and fair. Loved him!

Very kind, knowledgeable and understanding. Take his class only if you're actually willing to put in the effort and work for your grade. He is not there to give you an easy A. It is definitely worth it and you will learn a lot. I always looked forward to his class.
Worst professor ever. I wish I read the reviews before registering for his class.
Take only if there is no other option

Students are easy to get deceived by his "clownish" behavior, but it gets you well on tests and quizzes. Yes, we need to study and stay on top of materials, but he is a tough grader who doesn't forgive, who doesn't help. Extra credit? What's that?

He's a great professor, one of the best at Hunter. He's very knowledgable and funny, but he's not like other professors that'll pass people who clearly don't understand the language. If you suck at Italian and you're not willing to put in the effort then you won't pass. Take his class if you actually want to learn to speak Italian.

Always helps you when you don't understand, always make sure you understand the topic before moving on, he makes sure you adapt a skill called "feeling the verb" i would definitely take his class again
If you dont care about GPA, take him.
Worst italian language professor ever
Worst itl professor ever
Always walks around the class to assist students. Goes over homework. Caring and open-minded. Organized lesson plans.
If you put effort in, he is more than happy to help you out. He is a tough grader, but as long as you put in the effort, it will pay off. Keeps class entertaining and interesting.

Hardest class of my semester, and it was not even a part of my major. This might have been manageable if he had made being in class even slightly enjoyable. He is quick to discourage you or accuse the class of not being proficient enough. I was always afraid to have the wrong answer. Don't bother asking for extra credit, he laughed when I asked.

He may seem like a rude/mean professor at first impression. Overall he is a very funny and sarcastic person. The way he teaches can be confusing at times, but he is always willing to help. A lot was learned in a short time and I enjoyed the class.

He is funny, witty, and smart, that being said he is a hard teacher. I kept hearing other classmates say as a person he is cool but he is an incredibly hard grader. Very tough grader but he is fair and cares about teaching you.
Good teacher but expects u to know too much vocab at the point where u have to be fluent to do his tests which r reading passages. Responds to emails fast, but is sarcastic & even he admits it

She was terrific. She was patient but assertive and didn't sugarcoat anything. It was rough for me in the beginning, but she took her time and explained what needed to be done, and I passed. Thank you, Professor Fadem.

Professor Fadem is an inspiration. As a writer, she is an artist with a sensitive nature that allows her to be in touch with her students. This skill was key in guiding the class toward some of the best discussions I've ever experienced in a learning environment. This class challenged me as a person and a student. It truly broadened my horizons.

I absolutely love this course. Everything about it was incredible engaging - the discussions were natural and inspired deep, critical thinking, the primary reading materials were fascinating, and the critical bibliography was diverse and enlightening. Prof. Fadem is great!

Professor Fadem has been tremendous. So enthusiastic about sharing her deep knowledge of the material. She provides detailed comments on papers, organizes extracurricular screenings of films, and actively engages with students' ideas in class. My head is swimming with ideas to contemplate after every session.
A totally amazing class! Loving it!
This was a fantastic and challenging class. Prof. Vaz Borges is very responsive outside of the course, and the readings/ overall course planning was extremely thoughtful and thorough.

The most useful part of the course was closely reading the professor's own work- it gave us a chance to study a topic with an expert, but it also allowed us to discuss methodology in her work and in ours, such as how to make sense of archival knowledge and history.

Pretty straight forward online class. Labs, quizzes and final. She gives work early on so you can complete it before its due. My only problem was that not all the links worked for the labs and some photos didn't load for the quiz. If you send her a snapshot of it, she'll give you credit. VERY easy course,
This guy does not know how to teach. He is just there to fix problems, but he does not care for his students.

This is probably the best choice for a CS10300 at CCNY. He actually cares about what the students are learning and teaches at an INTRO level unlike the other professors. He will spend time on all the questions you don't understand and is willing to debate why you've lost points on some questions. Exams are easy if you go to class. Amazing prof.
He is a really good professor. He provides lots of practices and I can learn solid skills.

Avoid if possible, very self centered and condescending to the students in class. She did not seem to value students perspectives and often dismissed their comments. She does not appear to have the qualities of a professor and would be better of working in the back office.

I took Structural Equation Modeling with Dr. Wang. At this point I've taken 3 graduate level statistics courses, and he has been the best by far. He's incredibly intelligent, really eager to help, and breaks thing down really nicely. He also provides easy R scripts and efficiently covers all course material.
Means well but unskilled in fostering productive discussion and differences, would not take again
She is by far the worst professor at SPS. Almost every week we have 2 assignments to do. She is not caring at all and does nothing to help her students when they show signs of vulnerability.
his thought is very conventional

Prof. Parikh is pretty bad. All he teaches is straightforward theory with no applications. We once asked him to help us work out a tricky hw problem and he brushed it off saying that it's "too easy". Midterm and Final exams require you to memorize the material, not study it. You won't learn anything useful so avoid at all costs.
This guy is a killer. Does not know his students. Is not able to deliver material. Avoid at all costs!
Avoid this guy
No Comments

Took his Discrete Structures class in the Spring. I can see why many students would find him difficult, but the subject itself is difficult and he provides a boatload of resources to study from outside of class. It's going to be hard whether or not you're good at math, but you'll learn and enjoy learning it too. Ask questions whenever you have to.

This man does not know how to teach at all. His lectures have nothing to do with the work assigned then he will berate the class for not doing well. He told my class he can fail every one of us if he needs to & he won't be curving at all. His grading? Basically up to him how much each section weighs. My 4.0 average will most definitely be affected.

This man has no clue on how to effectively teach this course. As evidence, on the first day he sites several books and online lecture videos to use during his course and then states that If you don't understand him then you should find the information somewhere else. If you can't explain a concept it in simple terms then you don't understand it.
His way of grading is unpredictable.

He has a sneaky attitude while he is teaching. He usually doesnt mean what he says. Taking this class doesnt mean if you know algorithms or not. even if you do very bad in this class you can work on algos and do great. his style just sucks. useless. Look at other universities, they cover algos much more better, at least they tend to teach.

I agree with previous reviews. Bar-noy is a great professor that somehow is misunderstood by some.  I find his accent amusing at times and not at all confusing.  At the first day he advises on the long term goals you have, and wants to get to know the student's past regarding Algorithms experience.  Take him and don't have a doubt about it. Shalom

If you do your JOB and STUDY, you will be well rewarded.  Professor that teaches you to remember for the long run, not skim over the material like others do.  Do your part and study and you will easily make it through the class.  The professor is very well prepared on the Algorithms topic and holds some patents as well, but STUDY and study HARD
he is your adversary, that s all i can say.
Arrogant, rude and boring...

Great! You don't need to memorization. He gives homework that make you think. You don't have to come to the class. You can take an A just with midterm and final. He is fun, clear and helpful and he knows his subject very well. I think he would offer more if the course was more advanced (most ppl had already taken an intro alg class before)
Some people just shouldn't teach.  True he knows a lot, but he is so disrespectful and rude that the point is often lost.

Bar-Noy refuses to teach this required course, repeating the mantra, "you are PhD students; learn for yourselves." But he also does not respect independent research or thought when students do so. You MUST attend the "optional" lectures, as he will assign worse grades to those who do not.

Yes, he's unclear and arrogant. He presents simple ideas in convoluted ways. His style of teaching just didn't work for me, neither does his personality. I highly discourage talking to him in private. He can get very judegmental, ciritical, and rude.
Purely awful!  He's arrogant and unclear.  He assumes that students know everything and refuses to "waste his time" teaching anything.
Great teacher, brilliant computer scientist and a genuinely nice guy! He is willing to work with you, if you make the effort so will he.
He's super nice and tries to be helpful but he's not all that knowledgeable so you'll end up teaching most of it to yourself. He's a very easy grader.
I agree with the previous comments. He seems to "prefer" some students.

He is such an ignorant individual. Looks like he is doing things but nothing of any use to the students. It is true that he favors some students and ignores the ones he does not like. Never answers you directly always gives you the runaround.
No Comments
I agree, he is not a fair person. Worst thing is that he is the chairperson of the program.
Have to agree, if he doesn't like you, you've lucked out. But really, he's position should have no effect on your education, all he does is sign things anyway.
I agree with the previous poster.  Terrible.
He is the most arrogant person I ever saw. He hates some students, and prefer some. GC will be a good place, if you don't have a person like TED. Get away from him.
She can be cold but she's brilliant and really cares about the material she's teaching.

Prof. Chave is very respectful. She is interested in students' ideas. Paper was returned with meticulous comments. She askes thought-provoking questions in classes. She does not offer direct answers in seminars. True Feminist whose belief and behaviors are in harmony. She may seem to be cold from outside, but very warm & caring person in reality.

She can be a smart professor, but I think her brain stopped somewhere in the late 1970s/early 1980s. Her ideas can be incredibly archaic. She is the quintesential essentialist feminist and quite hetero****. It's too bad because she specializes in identity politics. Yikes!
cold
No Comments

This is a class that will change how you read... and think about ... memoirs. The conversations are great with a diverse group of people who show you things you didn't see / get in the first reading. This is really about the value of other people's POV in reading a work, about how reading is a group exercise that develops empathy. Highly recommend.

Dishonest and not willing to give real critiques in workshops.  Just goes with the flow and enjoys celebrity status. A brillant writer but totally unwilling to spend an ounce of extra energy on behalf of students. Should have to live off the royalities from his books instead of masquerading as a teacher and subsidizing his intellectual adventures w

Amazing individual. Fine novelist. Acclaimed poet. Personable. Listening to him spout his ideas, you'll imagine you're in a Terry Gilliam epic satirizing the modern university. He'll spend a half hour on a heroine's sleeve in an Ozu film, or dwell on Lana Turner's hairdo, or compare the peanuts in "Duck Soup" to certain private parts. He's a trip.
Brilliant, original, poetic - at times a child peaks out, and one sees in him the original wonder and love of literature - This professor simply glows and sparkles with heartfelt brilliance!
The belle of the ball and he knows it. Perhaps the best dressed and nicest professor in NYC. Smart and original course offerings and great insights most of the time.

U can do all H.W. U not pass. He is a racist republican who supports trump. Im not sure how Lehman has him working their still. He doesnt give U any idea of ur grade. So u can drop the class. 1sided. RUN plz Save ur self & DONT take. Professor DNt Post weekly assignments u must teach self w/ syllabus. Run. U wont pass. No compassion 2 Stu Effort
Terrible professor. Completely one-sided and biased. Tried to push research topic on me that had nothing to do with my interests (even after I told him so) Do not take!
Lots of books in this class. Tests are severely hard.

This professor has his strengths and weaknesses.  Strengths are that his supportive, challenges you to think and speak your mind wisely, and is reasonable with amount of school work given.  Negatives are that he does teach only the research and arguments that support his research, assigns alot of his own books, and is one sided. But I liked him.

I disagree with the below rating.  Renshon often times demonstrated a lack of understanding of the readings.  He seemed to zero in only on parts that were relevant to his own research.  And demonstrated an inability to ask questions that stimulated thinking.

Renshon has a bad rep, but it is undeserved.  He is very well informed on a variety of subjects from IR to Political Psychology.  He requires that you put as much into the class as he does.  He is a wonderful advisor who will help you navigate the dissertation, getting published, and getting a job.  If you have a chance, take him.
People at CUNY hate him because he's a Republican.  But he knows is stuff and is rigorous.  Also he challenges the leftist dogma that rules Grad Center.  Worth taking.

This guy is truly the worst professor at the Grad Center.  He seemed to have a rudimentary understanding of the readings and he wasn't very interested in objectively exploring the theories; only his own research agenda.  He's basically a newspaper regurgitator - don't take him.

Just an intellectual bully.  Doesn't tolerate questions YOU are interested in, only ones that interest HIM.  Not as learned as he makes out.  Just avoid (if you can).

Just an intellectual bully.  Won't tolerate disagreement, any questions that don't interest him, or requests for clarification.  He's smart, but that won't do you any good.  Avoid avoid avoid.

If you wantna learn about about mind or language this guy is highly recommended.  If you have little or no experience/interest in the subject, DO NOT take his class.  Very serious, amazingly smart, a bit impatient, philosophicaly slippery, awkward to talk to one-on-one, well-organized/delivered lect

Prof. Rosenthal has a natural understanding on how to teach philosophy to the receptive mind.  I can say I am a practitioner of the "Rosenthal style" of teaching philosophy.  He has no tolerance for allowing perceived irrelevance to cut into discussion, but not necessarily omniscience on that topic.
A great lecturer...almost worth his many, many idiosyncracies...

Make sure you take at least one course with him. He is a gentle person with a violent hatred of pompous 'non-gentle' people, so don't be arrogant in his class.  He knows better more than you.  DO NOT BE LATE!

a VERY intelligent man, but rushes through material too quickly. often drags out his answer to a question so that he's giving a mini-lecture on the history of philo. can be abrupt. ill at ease. needs to relax - i recommend trips to the mediterranean.

One of the worst I've ever seen in action!  He knows his stuff, but does not tolerate anyone who does not act just like him.  Not helpful at all.  Particularly seems to avoid helping women.  Gives dirty looks in class and can be  dismissive.

Vastly underrated.  Often taken to be obnoxious by students who are themselves obnoxious.  A bit high-strung and intimidating, but overall an incredibly brilliant and kind individual.  (Just don't come in late...)

Granted, he knows the philosophy of mind lack the back of his hand. To his credit, if you pay attention then so will you. My question is why, after 1000 years of teaching can't he calm down a touch? DON'T EVER BE LATE... trust me...
Prof has a poor "chairside manner" though is quite lucid in his discussion.  If you have thin skin, be careful what you say in class.
One of the worst teachers ever. Really bad temper.  His most common response to well thought out philosophical arguments: "I don't understand??" followed by "END OF STORY!!"
The best philosophy has to offer.
Kripke is, no doubt, brilliant (and very witty!) Take his class and you won't regret it (though sometimes I wish he'd unpack his thoughts a little more ...)
I agree with the previous rating. The seminar on Frege was very good.
I took his Frege course and I had a great time. I hope he publishes the lectures.

Could be intimidating but his seminar is definitely worth taking. His take on philosophical problems is always deep and original. Don't expect textbook explanations: you need to know something about the topic to take his class.

i couln't agree more with the previous rating.  he's selfish, doesn't prepare for class at all so that he wastes loads of class time thinking things through, and is as far from the socratic ideal of teaching excellence as can be.  unlike socratic teachers, he could care less about his audience.
No Comments
No Comments
He's so smart that it's traumatizing being alone with him in a room. Sure, take his classes, but not for credit.

He may deserve a higher rating for clarity but clarity is relative to the person hearing the lecture. Given my lack of IQ, I can only follow some of what he says. When I do follow, I am deeply impressed. He is a sweet guy, but clearly not normal

SK, when he shows, is a great lecturer.  He is of course the smartest person in philosophy these days, and clearly the brightest person I ever took a class with.  Unfortunately, rumor has it, that he will be doing his own grading starting soon.
you have heard all the stories, but he's a nice guy.. you should take a class with him because he's Saul Kripke

Saul Kripke is smarter than anyone I've ever met. Saul Kripke is very funny. Saul Kripke has trouble delivering a lecture on just one topic. Saul Kripke has trouble showing up all the time. Well worth the trouble but alot of work to keep up with him.

Probably the best professor you will encounter in your lifetime if you were to be bound learning at CUNY.  Responds to emails very promptly and actually helps out.  He is extremely intelligent to the point of being scary, yet he levels with us slower humans and tries his best to teach to the point it makes perfect sense. Thank you professor Fitting

Melvin Fitting is by far the greatest lecturer I have seen in my academic career. Every topic makes sense; even to a complete novice in mathematical logic. Take every class he teaches. His exams are very fair and homework is short yet effective. Grading is kind of harsh; but that's the fault of the grader.
Fitting fits the mold of a classic professor. His lectures are clear and easy to follow. He assigns tough (sometimes impossible) homework, but his tests are fairly easy.
He should give the other Computer Science professors some classes on how to present material in a clear and consise way.

He is one of the best professors that GC has!  He is very clear, intelligent and he's very approachable.  This is a rarity at GC.  Most profs just spew random facts at you and assume that everyone already knows everything, pure laziness.  Fitting blows them away!
intimidatingly brilliant man

the class was alright. she's a nice woman and means well, but the material was kind of hard to understand. the overall grade is mostly just the 2 tests and final paper, so if you understand whats going on in class, you'll be alright.

Prof. S. is sophisticated, smart, fun, and cares a lot about her students. I never wanted to miss a lecture. She also really pushes students to grow intellectually and as writers. I have always found her very respectful towards students, even when she challenges them. Highly recommended.

I was lucky she was at the grad center at the time.  One of the few professors teaching political theory in the philosophy department with a critical bent.  I took one course on Rawls, another on Kant, and she was even willing to do an independent reading group on Marx (which no one was teaching in the department then). She knows her stuff...

Class discussions were lively and illuminating.  She challenges students to engage critically with the material and back up their views (which I suppose must seem combative to some, but I always found her respectful).  Her comments on papers are very detailed and helpful.

She is very helpful, enthusiastic, and passionate about philosophy. The former poor reviews are merely refections of some students' serious and sad insecurities and their need to overcompensate for them.

Schwarzenbach is without any exaggeration the WORST teacher I have had in 18 years of schooling.  She does not prepare for class.  She personally attacks students (both ideologically and personally).  She is the paragon of useless lecturing, frequently failing to finish sentences.  If she allows students to speak at all, she usually interrupts them

She is a disgrace to pedagogy.  Rusty with material.  Needlessly defensive.  Disorganized.  Lets class go off-topic every time and is incapable of restoring order (or is too dense to notice what's happened). You will learn nothing.  The idea that this person has a phd from Harvard and teaches grad students could be a plot for the Twilight Zone.

She clearly knows TJ and PL well.  She also reminds you that she was his student.  If you make small, but only small criticisms of Rawls and emphasize how great he was, you'll be fine.  She doesn't handle disagreement too well.

Her lectures sometimes feel more like an episode of "Crossfire" than a class in political philosophy. This can be exciting, but also unenelightening. She has a tendency to commit falacies when she is cornered. She is clearer in person than in cl

This professor wouldn't deign to have an intellectual conversation with a grad student like myself. Instead, he made a lot of ad hominem attacks like why wasn't I married! The fact that I had been attacked by a male grad student never crossed his mind because very little did.

I have had nothing but excellent experiences with Prof. Kelly. During this course, "Revolution and the Word" he was open and congenial to all the students in the class. His vast knowledge of the field, early American lit., is a great boon for any student. He actually made me interested in early American texts. Take this class!

I asked the professor for a letter of recommendation three years out of the course. He said the time period was too long to write me a recommendation. Yet the novels we studied in the course were 200 years old. If 3 years is too long to write a rec, what are we doing reading 200-year-old novels that have far less relevance to modern culture?

When I made original comments in this class, I was informed my ideas were sophmoric and inchoate. When I repeated conventional wisdom, I was told I was unoriginal and derivative. The moral of the story is that if the professor doesn't like you you'll get a bucketful of nonsensical nuggets of his wisdom to be satirized for effect at parties.

As an applicant a PhD program, my references were contacted by phone without my notice or permission. Other faculty not among my reference letters were also contacted. I have heard of tenure track professor applicants being treated like this but not doctoral applicants.
No Comments

He has his share of attentive acolytes, but when it's time to act like African-American lit and feminist lit actually meant more than words on the page, this prof is nowhere to be found. He's a self-appointed gatekeeper to the profession with "me-first" rules.

Charisma, intellect, drive and competence have taken Kelly to the upper eschelons of GC administration. He is a New Historicist ad naseum, and all the life he brings into the classroom seldom finds its way into the kind of ideas that make a graduate seminar worth attending. Kind, he is also demanding and has a temper; hardly has the time to teach.

a rhetorician in every since of the word. He is a great listener, though sometimes I felt the conversation drifted too far into the realms of pure speculation and conjecture. Not that there's anything wrong with that, it's just that these flights weren't accompanied by tangible arguments by students
Prof. Kelly has an ability that is rare among many instructors: he listens to his students. He is incredibly interactive, warm, and welcoming in the classroom.
Excellent teacher. Found myself wishing class was longer than two hours -- a rarity!

Diana is truly one of the most gifted and dedicated teachers I've ever had. Also, she's so smart and interesting to listen to. The class is a beast due to the fact that you're trying to learn German in a few months, but if you take advantage of the extra help offered you'll get through. It's a great review of core grammatical concepts as well.

I learned a lot in her class, although I wish it had been slightly less geared toward (obnoxious, privileged, narcissistic) art history students. A syllabus would have really helped to keep the class organized and on track despite the interruptions of students who don't understand basic grammar. If you *do* understand grammar, you'll learn a lot.

Definitely one of the best professors I've ever had and probably the most intelligent person I've ever met.  She selects a wide range of interesting and relevant writings and puts a lot of time into the course.
One of the best teachers I ever had. Invests a great deal of effort in helping students and with results.
One of the best teachers I ever had. Really takes an interest in seeing people learn.
No Comments

It's an easy class with a lot of assignments. I didn't learn any French with her, no enthusiasm at all. She is nice  and I like how she offers to help students yet her monotone voice reading the textbook all the time in class, didn't help with actually learning French. This class is so boring.

I have her now and she looks extremely bored out of her mind with her job. When you ask her a question it appears thats thes bothered by the fact that your asking her a question. When she speaks to you shes stares at the back wall or the floor never really makes eye contact. By far the worst professor I've had.

Without a doubt, one of the worst professors I've had. She looks bored out of her mind,is  unclear, never makes eye contact with the students, and seems personally offended if a student asks a question, thus destroying all chance of a student-oriented classroom.She basically reads the textbook out loud for the entirety of the 3 hr class
While her presentation does lack a certain affect and excitement, Monica clearly loves the language. If you want to learn French, she is a good person to learn it from.
INTELLIGENT, BUT BORED WITH HER JOB.  OBVIOUSLY NOT ENTHUSIASTIC ABOUT TEACHING FRENCH.
Dr. Revenson  is an awful professor.  Avoid her if you can.
The worse teacher ever. She seems chemically imbalanced. I heard she treats her students working on thesis like dirt. Stay away at all cost. They should fire her.
No Comments
No Comments

I think she takes herself a little too seriously. I, too, did not understand the grades I received on my exams. She gave us ethics vignettes and we had to write essays on them for our exam, so the grading became very subjective. The material is easy, but somehow getting an A is difficult. Very frustrating compared to other graduate classes.

Requires alot of work and in-class participation. Her grading scheme is a mystery which makes it difficult to do well in her class. I did not find her very helpful or approachable. Others seemed to think she was okay.
Who the hell appointed this man as the chair? He should also stay away from teaching!

He is one of the most condescending professors I have ever met.  He does not care how YOU interpret the text. He is judgmental, unfair with students, and arrogant.  Although he is very knowledgeable in what he teaches, he is very discriminating when it comes to lit. All the books he likes are "good" lit. and all the books he hates are "bad" lit!

i really love him, he knows his literature very well and has an interesting and relevant sense of humor, he makes it so that he selects part of a text and you want to read the next, SIGN up for this class and you will not regret it, i love his class
He is a very good professor with an interesting sense of humor. He definitly cares about his students and about the department in general.

absolutely not interested in his students and what they think about a particular topic. papers should be done in a certain way. if youre fine with that and dont ask too much help from him, he's knowledgeable and you actually learn .
No Comments

Aciman is an intelligent instructor with tons of insights in his particular fields. His classes are not easy. One can learn a lot from him, but must be prepared for his morose sense of humor and lack of interest in helping students outside of class.
Wonderful professor. Very intelligent, witty, passionate about his field.   His pass is a true loss the the academic community.
at 70 years old, nobel prize winner

PhD courses in Econometrics.  Dr Neftci required the student to work, too.  Many can't take that level of personal responsibility, and do not get everything from Neftci's class that is possible.  Tough, irascible and a gem.
A giant in his field, and a professor who was willing to take you beyond the material.  One of the best.

It is true that he is very busy and "economizes" on individual student interaction, but he is a great economist and a great communicator (unless you get fixated on his accent and not hear him). Plus, he knows what he teaches and he teaches PhD students who do not need to be held by the hand.

Took a class with him in Switzerland. Although the material was interesting he just didn't teach enough. He doesn't give a damn about the teaching and his arrogance gets in the way of clear explanations.
Terrible

Dr. Neftci is too busy flying all over the world doing god-knows-what vs. his JOB. I can't believe that this person would be chosen to run anything, let alone an academic program. His attitude, organizational skills, and lack of focus were very challenging. He is not the great man he claims to be. Sad, sad...

Nefci was  major scam at the GC at least for first 2 econometric courses.Instead of helping students to prepare for acad.research he was telling crappy jokes and was not able to run through five lines of his preprogramed Mathlab procedures.Wish to meet PHD student who can say he learned something useful.He was okay and useful in his finance class.
He is nice, he gives everybody A. The stuff that he's teaching is hard, but he explains good, read the book. He's mostly busy, doesn't want to deal with you.
He was good in saying jokes,otherwise very poor for two courses supposed to introduce students to econometrics necessary to their research.
Poor teaching preparing, hard to understand.
No Comments

Only 3 students signed up for his International Trade course, just to show that nobody wants to take his course if they have a choice.  2 students were forced by EO to register to make it 5 students so this course won't get cancelled.

You really have to be very careful what you say to this guy, because he will remember it and give you a bad grade no matter how hard you try.  He puts on a fake friendly smile. Beware!!!  Some people think that he's nice. Again, that's for the unsophisticated who can't discern insincerity.
Prof Gram is an intelectual and there is no dillema about it.The book he uses is self sufficient .

The professor stated at the beginning that he does things differently than the professor for Micro I, and that became abundantly clear.  There was very little knowledge of economics gained; exams consisted of questions based on memorization of his confusing notes.  The professor is spiteful, favoring students who never express their frustration.
Learning econ can't get any worse than this.  Did not learn anything useful at all!
It's hard to get interested in his class, since his lectures consist only of equations, matrices, and more equations.  Very dull.
Notes are hard to follow, pretty much have to dig thru all the meaningless parts of the notes and try to dicipher what's relevant and what's not.
Boring and poitless.
No Comments

If you're taking this class thinking it will be easy, definitely pick another course. I enjoyed this class because I wanted to learn about film, but I was a little bit shocked about how bad I was initially doing in the course. Some of the feedback is unhelpful, but if you stick with it and put in the effort, you'll end with a good grade.

Don't think about taking his class, he's extremely passionate about this subject. so whatever you do, you can't please him unless you're able to compete with him. despite completing homework and everything I was left with a Negative B. And he says he doesn't give out A's. this class was an absolute disaster  as well as the prof.

If you're not passionate about film. DO NOT TAKE THIS! I had to take this class only because I don't really like art and so I thought film would be fun but I was wrong. For an intro class it was pretty difficult, the professor was a very harsh grader, didn't give good feedback, and his final exams and projects were just too much.

If youre not passionate about film then I suggest dont take this class. This professor is very difficult treats us as if we were professionals. Midterm and final exam we have to watch a movie clip and then hand write about the techniques that they use. Overall its not a fun class its very draining and I don't reccomend. He's a very tough grader.

came into this class at John Jay thinking it was an intro class and would be easy, and it was the complete opposite. He dives deep into the material and asks a lot. you need to want to be into film in order to take the class. bot for people that want to take the class as an elective or to just get it out of the way.
Way to much hw. He takes his creative expression class a little to seriously and expects everyone else to take it as serious. Dont take this professor unless you like doing hw.

This class is too much. He cares about what he is teaching, but really expects you to get it. This class should not be taken by a student who's never had a film class in their life. This should be a senior class, too much for freshman to handle. Beware of the HW, there is so much HW in this class. If you are taking this class, God help you.

I had an enjoyable time taking this professor, but if youre unwilling to do the work that he gives you, which is a group presentation for 10-15 minutes and a 1500 word paper, with many other homework assignments, dont take him. Otherwise he is a good professor
This class for me was overall so hard. Taking this class was the worst thing I did because it was very had for me to understand what he was saying. He is not very clear he is very messy.
Absolute toss. Made the mistake of not looking up professors before picking classes and payed the price. DO NOT TAKE. You won't get good grades and you'll be constantly stressed all the time.

He asks for a lot in his classes but he teaches so much. I took his film class and have learned so much from him. Granted I took this class 2 years ago but I don't know what these other people are saying because I got an A. It does take a lot of work though and his final project is very difficult plus lots of reading every week
He does not give A's. This ruined my first year GPA and made me panic every day. Do not take this professor

I took his Intro to Film class and it ruined my GPA. From day one he tells you that he's doesn't give A's. No matter how hard I tried the highest grade I got all semester was a 75. On top of that he gives barely any feedback as to why you got such a poor grade. So frustrating and not worth the stress. Avoid taking this class if you can.

I just did not like him. I got stuck with this class and he literally tells you at the beginning he won't give you an A. His work is way to hard and he doesn't give clear instructions or feedback. His lectures are interesting if you want to know HOW to make a film. YOU WILL NOT JUST WATCH MOVIES! DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!

I had him for LIT 106, it was the worst decision of my life. I don't have a cumulative GPA of 4.0 because of him. Do not expect an A from him no matter how hard you try. He specifically said he never gives out an A. He grades so tough for a creative expression class, not at all flexible and doesn't tell you why you got such a bad grade.
He is just out to make life extremely hard for you. Watch out for him
Hard grader and too much homework for a creative expression class, don't take him.

I took him for LIT 106,  which is intro to film. This class is TOUGH.  Weekly HW assignments plus alot of essays. Dont get me wrong he was a fun guy and definitely knows his stuff, but he assigns alot of work, all of which is very writing intensive.  Tests/quizzes  are you to watch 2 random film clips and compare and contrast technical aspects.

Do not take this professor if you have a lot going on, if you skip one day you'll fail the entire semester. Gives an assignment every tuesday based on the lecture from monday. Everything is graded heavily and he gives no extra credit.   Very Boring and Talks A LOT Do not recommend
If you have a lot going on don't take him. Pop quizzes based on readings and expects you to teach him something he doesn't know. Not very helpful when he read every book thousands of times. Ruins gpa
Brilliant lecturer, knows his stuff very intimately. Highly recommended.
Not helpful at all unless you are one of his doctoral students. Good discussions in class. Plays favorites.

He's knowledgeable in the minutia of his field, but watch out if you aim for any individual time with this guy.  He's always looking at his watch.  I wouldn't say he seems particularly devoted to helping his students.

A real piece of. . . work. Clearly had not prepared any of the classes. He had no syllabus. His "seminars" consist primarily of self-aggrandizing monologues. He has a Greenbergian notion of culture. Believes wholeheartedly in authentic "high-culture," all this, despite studying "minor" --in the D&G sense-- languages; hypocrite?
I would not recommend this professor. He doesn't realized or respect the fact that people actual have lives outside of class.
I love this professor.  He is an excellent one.  Of course, you have to work in his classes but you will learn a lot. Muy bien preparado!!
Very kind, charasmatic, and of course, brilliant.  Very personable and professional at the same time.  He's like a working publication.  Plus, he resembles Gorge Cloony!

Nice guy, but I wouldn't recommend taking his class. I know it's an english course, but ALL you do is read from this HUGE book of literature, and have boring class discussions. He never gave any tests or quizzes, which I was happy about at first, but in the long it didn't help me. He's a tough grader too. Wouldn't recommend if you're a bad writer.

DO NOT TAKE HIS CLASS! He is not a good professor at all. He thinks his opinion is the right one and if you don't agree with his, you're wrong. Gave weekly page long papers on very long readings and his grading depends on his mood. His class was extremely boring! DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR FOR ANY CLASS!

he seemed intimidating at first but then he warmed up. has a rich understanding of the reading material. 5 tests-very easy as long as you read & show up. 4 B.B. forums. & a final exam. no essays which is great considering it almost never happens in an ENG class. he knows the material is dense so he grades easily. be ready to read out loud in class!

Very excited to take a course with this professor. Until I took a course with this professor. He is not a trustworthy teacher, and there was so much hedging anytime the conversation threatened to get real, I actually wondered if he had done the reading. A graduate course should have more depth and involve more learning, less posing.

It doesn't get better than this--Singer's course was my favorite at the GC. He is a gentleman and quite often amazing in his approach to the work. You learn more in one semester in the NY Studies class than you could imagine. BRAVO!

This Liberal Studies course in American Culture and Values was great. Singer is an exceptional intellect and very supportive. I strongly recommend it for both experienced and brand new graduate students. You will really like this professor.

Last semester, Dr. Singer's course in "film and history" was one of the most interesting and rewarding experiences I ever have had at CUNY. He is a caring and brilliant man, exceptionally well-prepared, and with a sense of humor too. STRONGLY RECOMMEND whatever he is teaching.

Dr. Singer is simply amazing. He is as brilliant as he is humane (and often funny). He changed the way I look at film theory and aesthetics in relationship to the field of history. This graduate course is a pleasure; I wish it ran for a whole year! BRAVO!!

One of the smartest professors at GC. Lectures are extremely rich, demonstrating knowledge of practically every advance in science and even little bits of poetry (e.g., Dante's Inferno). He really wants his students to learn. I want to be able to lecture like him at some point in the distant future. Plus, he is genuinely a very very good person.
Sc's realism was a demanding course, but Cordero is good. A lot of reading required, etc!
A very fruitful class. This prof is a treasure house of philosophical insight into science.
ugghhhh
A total jerk. Hard to understand and so unclear, unhelpful. Plays favorites and will mess up your GPA. Have fun!!!

Here is another incident: in the midterm two questions were wrong. There were students who got over 90 and there were students who got like 60's. She didnt care to cancel the questions, instead, "curve will leverage it", she said. wtf? how will it do that? that was retarded and wrong.

She is horrible. the worst class in the first level. She forgets everything. she is not consistent and stable. Here : She asks us to write 20 pages of comparison paper on 3 other research papers. While she was reviewing mine, she notes that I didnt define something which was actually defined one paragraph before. That s just wrong.
One of the few interesting courses of the first year. Not just useless theory like the rest.
Expert & interesting
I would gladly skip it if it wasn't required course. Nothing interesting.
She certainly has an idea of what she is talking about but just transmit it
No Comments

Despite her notes, Griffeth seems to work things out in her head while at the front of the class. This does not work for all students, but it gave me insight to her thought process, which made me better at the subject. She is very approachable, treats students with a great amount of respect and is one of the unsung gems of the Graduate Center.
Very unorganized and unclear.  You're better off just reading the book.
Excellent Professor & person.  Highly Recommended.
He's my hero.  Nobody else can take that book and explain it so well.  Perfect balance of theory and examples.  Listen to him and read the book if you want an A.
Funny guy.  His notes are a bit disjoint and things were a bit rushed...  but at least he seems to care about students (which is more than you can say about most of the first year professors).

Yanofsky is charming, often entertaining, but I think he's often faking knowledge of the subject, which is just as well. This class is a New Deal program for out-of-work mathematicians. Listen to Yanofsky talk about Quantum Computing instead. That's much better... and something he really knows.

He is one of the gems in his field. He is very knowledgeable. The only problem with him is he is very theoretical. Sometimes, simplifying the theory or visualizing it could be helpful. If you have strong math background easy to follow otherwise you will need to spend a lot of time to figure things out. He is truly an amazing person.
Great Professor, always there to help!!!!!!! Talk hard things in a easy and understandable way!!!!!
Pretty straightforward professor.  Willing to meet anytime we had problems understanding the requirements.  Would take another class of his again if I were to be interested in the subject

Very enthusiastic professor, but he gives absolutely no examples in his theoretical probability and statistics lectures! Slides are incomprehensible and consist only of mathematical symbols, no explanations, no comments -- nothing but textbook definitions. Two projects, first one is worth 20% and is insanely demanding! Second is a research project.
he is a wolf in sheep's costume
Interesting discussions and bright but rather rude especially in paper comments. takes student ideas different from him as challenging his ego
Not an easy class, but very well explained material. Clear and smart. Highly recommended.

One thing is for sure: he is very smart, knows a lot, and forces you to think think and think some more. He may lack some organizational skills in teaching but he makes up for it in other ways. Always helpful when asked. A bit slow in answering emails (not always). Overall, I would recommend him.

The absolute worst instructor I have had at any level for any subject.  He is super arrogant, takes differing points of view personally, seems to care less about his students and is never clear about what he wants.  Worse, he forgets his own policies and penalizes students for it.  Many people took W's rather than endure the whole semester w/ him!

He does a great job at asking interesting questions forcing people to draw connections within the literature and think by yourself.  I see why many people who would prefer an easier class do not like it, but if you want to get to read interesting stuff and to think about it, this is a good professor for it. And grading is not bad at all if you work

supernarcisistic!!! yep...that's all what you get from this guy.let's not talk about his grading. if you thought in finding a nurturing scholar, this is the wrong class.the content: pol.sci methods, you can take the same class with prof. Woodward who is a better prof. and made Boudreau's original syllabus. he's only an unsecure copy-cat

Reading & participating are crucial to passing this course because it helps you answer the midterm and final. There are smaller assignments as well, but overall the major requirement to pass this course is to express that you understand what you've learned through real-time events. She is very understanding and easy to get along with. Don't be shy!
Outstanding teacher because of her preparation skills and presentations in class;and willingness to help when the concepts were  difficult to understand. MDM
Very informative, knowledgeable, and easy to talk to - she helped me a lot.
No Comments

300 pages a reading a week from 5 or more authors. You have to at least skim all the reading because she doesn't lecture, but is more Socratic. She'll call you out if you didn't do the reading. 3 5-page papers and a final exam. Great help in class. Her paper comments were less helpful, over focused on grammer and editing issues.

Very tough, but very fair. Heavy reading load, but its all good stuff. Pushes hard to bring out the best in students, and make them think harder about the subject. Recommend her class for anyone serious about comparative politics.
She is one of the best at the Graduate Center CUNY. She is very demanding, but you will get a lot from her class.  Take it if you have a chance!
TAKE HIM! Proff. Catto is an amazing teacher and an even more amazing human being.
He is a very nice guy. A little exotic. Really knows his stuff. Big inspiration. Known him for years.

Great Guy. He knows his stuff. He is very helpfull and brilliant. I am happy that I could learn some interesting physics from his class than prof.kheyfit`s. Sad part is that..Prof. Catto`s part was not included in the final exam. anyways..it`s glad that GC-Phyisics has got such an efficient excutive officer.
I took three courses with Prof. Parker. He is a rare, wonderful being. Take anything with him! It'll be an experience you will never forget.

Probably the most difficult prof at the GC in English, but certainly the one with the smallest ego. Parker is that rare prof that believes anyone can learn anything, and he'll push you to the limits of your understanding during every class period. He's a remarkable person, humbling to be around.

Splendid man, delightful professor. Managed to make reading the Leviathan seem both interesting and important. This is actually impossible to do, so that pretty much means Parker exists outside the ordinary laws of the universe. A very challenging, but very accessible prof.

A brilliant, wonderful, very inspiring teacher! I took a methods module class with her and learned more about ethnographic research than I thought possible. She really loves to help us do hands-on field-work and she's great at communicating ideas from her field. Would love to take class with her again. Very, very reccomended.
would love to get to do "field" work with this professor
Propf. Low ius extremely helpful an dpassionate about her subject. She also welcomes dissent and is very friendly both in and outside class.
Professor Low is a great teacher, and knows how to manage an interdisciplinary class. She is a concise thinker and gives useful feedback.

Professor had no interaction with the class, gave no feedback and was not interested in teaching. She was extremely difficult and never posted announcements. Didn't grade discussion board on a weekly basis, only knew how I was doing during mid-semester evaluations.
Very very organized, clear and comprehensive. Set up to run on its own, but too little interaction with this online class

CC404 - Global Culture @ CUNY Online BA    The class focused equally on globalization and culture, from a variety of angles.    The Bb Site is perfectly organized. Prof Sanford took great care in building a site that allows Students to find everything, with clear deadlines, concise instructions without logging in daily. No Team Projects.

Had her for Human Rights and Social Change in Latin America. Professor Sanford is fantastic: uses a great reading list and is doing very inspiring research/activities in the human rights field. I can't recommend her enough!
She was a wonderful educator - the true definition of the word.
It is impossible to say anything negative about Mary Ann. She's helpful, insightful, and knows everything about everything.
Class can get a little boring--for some reason, he doesn't stimulate very much conversation--but when he gets going on his lectures, he has a lot of good things to say about the material.
Great teacher. We fell a little behind, but he's got a massive amount of knowledge on the subject and his lectures were always engaging.
I adore this man. Brilliant, kind, deeply knowledgeable. A real pleasure to be in his class and to work with on just about anything.

He recommended me a lot of readings to shape my thesis. Those were very helpful.  He is open-minded to understand different cultures. He has a good sense of humor. His classes were quite intense and required lots of lots of readings. Also, he asked you to submit a paper based on a specific theme.  He is a tough grader as well.

I watched him discount Middle Eastern student voices for no reason at all but to be mean and assert his authority (something he has issues with).  He teaches MidEast Studies! I liked reading his book because I realized how self-conscious and poorly written, even well-researched scholarly work can be. Shame Shame!

Intolerant of different opinions. Offers only partial explanations of studies. NO professional integrity. Had students critique book HE co-authored, then graded students critiques of HIS book. NEVER explained why criticisms of own book were not valid.

Very demanding and not tolerant of opinions that do not mirror his own.  Very impatient.  If you don't get a concept the first time, he's likely not going to explain again.  Hard grader. Demands more than he gives.

A refreshing Weberian professor at the Graduate Center??!!! Could it be?! Classes are discussion-based on extensive reading of interesting and relevant political sociology material from a variety of sociological perspectives, not just marx. The work is not slavery--one long paper, and he does not dictate but wants creative participation. Enjoyable.

Prof. Senie is an extremely engaging professor who knows her material! She is incredibly thoughtful and thorough in her comments on your papers and dissertation. It is never about her point of view but about developing your arguments in a clear and concise manner. Her lectures are thought-provoking and class discussions are fierce. Love her!!!

Her ideas for classes are quite clever. She can be quite nice and helpful. However, she is not very bright. In her lectures she often gave us only the birthdays of her selected artists. I have heard better lectures from junior high school teachers. Although her classes can be a chore to endure, she can be very supportive of her students.

3 Midterm exams w/ lowest grade dropped, plus final. Lectures were fine, I don't think his accent was an issue at all. The hw was all from webassign and with occasional pesky difficulty much greater than lecture, and even recitation and exam. Lecture examples were sometimes easier than what was expected of you to know for the exam.

He did have a lot of readings for the lab manuals, and its a bit difficult to understand his accent, JK its really difficult to understand his accent, but eventually you get used to it. He is an easy grader and allows makeup reports.

His lectures were so dry and boring as you could barley understand him through his thicc accent. Grading was broken down into 2 midterms and a final and there was no homework. Typical lazy CUNY prof. The class was so easy I went like 10-15 times the whole semester . I got a C+ bc I Accidentally took one of the Midterms high and got a 42.
He's intelligent and knows his material but his accent can be hard to understand sometimes. His exams are a breeze and hes really nice.
Cool!
Excellent teacher!
He is very nice guy!
AMAZING MAN!

Blum is a genius. This guy knows something about every music around the world. Detail-oriented, a tough critic of your work. He will sculpt a musicologist out of you by any means necessary! Loved his class, felt better prepared for my field after 1 semester with him.

Not cruel; somewhat unusual only in that he's a temperamental genius.  You are wrong because you are wrong, and he will tell you.  If you want sunshine, go someplace else.  If you want to learn, go to Blum.
cruel and unusual, and punishment
He was instrumental in developing my thesis project and dissertation topic

He taught me a phrase that applies directly to his work and his expectations for student work: armchair sociology. He spends class time blathering on about anecdotal nonsense, never referring to the readings (which are dated and terrible) and doesn't seem to mind the discussion wandering aimlessly. His work we read was sloppy and purely anecdotal

Extremely erudite and eloquent, but without the accompanying arrogance. He has a contagious enthusiasm for his subject, and, although demanding in how he wishes his assignments to be written, his feedback is constructive and helpful. Definitely would recommend him to those who want a structured class, who can take criticism. Enjoyed muchly.

Took his urban political community class. He means well but the class was like a term long stream of consciousness. The class was not helped by his coteacher, John Mollenkopf. Just hope that they don't teach together ever again. Their class was like sitting in on a private conversation between the two of them.
